title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 25 August 2014 - XWiki
content:
<Denis> has joined #xwiki  
00:48 <Denis> has quit  
01:18 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
01:23 <sburjan> has quit  
01:36 <Denis> has quit

07:09 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
07:31 <andreeapopescu> has joined #xwiki  
07:34 <DarkKnightCZ> has quit  
08:57 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
09:25 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
09:26 <DarkKnightCZ> has joined #xwiki  
09:35 <Pbas> has joined #xwiki  
09:47 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
09:54 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
10:01 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
10:08 <DarkKnightCZ> has quit  
10:09 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
10:19 <DarkKnightCZ> has joined #xwiki  
10:26 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
10:27 <vmassol> good morning guys  
10:27 <vmassol> so we have 13 build jobs to fix ASAP  
10:27 <vmassol> today is supposed to be release day!  
10:27 <vmassol> btw who's the RM?  
10:27 <vmassol> Edy?  
10:28 <vmassol> BTW mflorea, gdelhumeau: this page is missing some love: http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Roadmaps/WebHome  
10:28 <vmassol> (would be nice to fill it at beginning of dev for a new release)  
10:29 <vmassol> the point is to provide visibilite at start + for us to check achieved vs planned  
10:33 <vmassol> anyone restarted jenkins an hour ago?  
10:33 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
10:33 <vmassol> Hi Enygma`  
10:34 <vmassol> just wanted to ensure you're the RM for 6.2M2  
10:34 <vmassol> (don't recall full if you were RM only for 6.2M1 or the full 6.2)  
10:34 <vmassol> s/full/fully  
10:36 <Enygma`> Hi vmassol  
10:36 <Enygma`> no, I only did 6.2M1, but I can do 6.2M2 as well.  
10:36 <Enygma`> I have been trying to take care a bit about the build, but it`s quite a handfull as it behaves a bit chaotically and I`ve sent some mails about it  
10:39 <vmassol> ATM the CI is behaving nicely  
10:40 <vmassol> if you can handle the release for 6.2M2 that's good  
10:40 <Enygma`> vmassol: yeah... we`ll have to see about that. After my last restart its behaving nicely for the past 1-2 days.  
10:40 <vmassol> we have 10 jobs to fix before we can release  
10:40 <vmassol> we need everyone to help out to fix those ASAP and start the release  
10:41 <Enygma`> I know. I have also been a bit blocked by the false positives we get... the one with "Unable to bind to locking port 7054 within 45000 ms"  
10:41 <Enygma`> have you seen my 2 mails about the failing tests?  
10:42 <Enygma`> one on this topic and another on the specifics of the html export (test)  
10:42 <vmassol> yes I've seen them but I don't have an answer ATM  
10:43 <vmassol> going to look at http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-ldap/3514/ now  
10:46 <Enygma`> so... basically we really need to kill running instances before we start a test  
10:48 <vmassol> I have worked in the past on improving how they are stopped. It used to worked fine for a long time. My guess is that SOLR or something liek this is now making XWiki xwiki not stop correctly for some reason from time to time. We would need to investigate this  
10:48 <vmassol> now ofc killing processes is a radical answer that we could also pursue  
10:48 <vmassol> (it won't solve the issue with xwiki not stopping for our users though)  
10:49 <vmassol> (so we would just hide the real problem)  
10:52 <Lyes> has joined #xwiki  
11:05 <Enygma`> we also have multiple generations of tests  
11:06 <Enygma`> maybe we have some duplicate/deprecated tearDown code that does not properly shut down the test instance in some of our tests  
11:20 <DarkKnightCZ> hi, is there bundled version of current development version? (M2)  
11:20 <vmassol> DarkKnightCZ: sure see http://enterprise.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/Download  
11:21 <vmassol> (bottom of page)  
11:21 <DarkKnightCZ> yup, thanks  
11:24 <vmassol> bb in 10mn  
11:27 <Lyes> Hi devs  
11:28 <Lyes> i have probleme with release of https://github.com/xwiki-contrib/macro-hierarchy-dynamic/  
11:28 <Lyes> i have message :  
11:28 <Lyes> Downloading: scp://maven.xwiki.org/home/maven/public\_html/snapshots/org/xwiki/contrib/macro-hierarchy-dynamic/1.0-SNAPSHOT/maven-metadata.xml  
11:28 <Lyes> The authenticity of host 'maven.xwiki.org' can't be established.  
11:28 <Lyes> [WARNING] Could not transfer metadata org.xwiki.contrib:macro-hierarchy-dynamic:1.0-SNAPSHOT/maven-metadata.xml from/to maven.xwiki.org (scp://maven.xwiki.org/home/maven/public\_html/snapshots): Cannot connect. Reason: Auth fail  
11:33 <vmassol> Lyes you need to read contrib.xwiki.org  
11:33 <vmassol> read the warnings  
11:33 <vmassol> under http://contrib.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/WebHome#HReleasetheproject  
11:34 <vmassol> make sure you use: mvn org.apache.maven.plugins:maven-release-plugin:2.5:prepare  
11:34 <vmassol> and mvn org.apache.maven.plugins:maven-release-plugin:2.5:perform  
11:36 <vmassol> just improved the doc to make it even simpler  
11:47 <Lyes> @Vincent: i try this , but i have the same message  
11:51 <lucaa> has quit  
12:05 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki  
12:06 <vmassol> Lyes you need to rollback your release first of course  
12:06 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
12:06 <vmassol> http://maven.apache.org/maven-release/maven-release-plugin/examples/rollback-release.html  
12:10 <vmassol> Lyes: as you can see here your tag is incorrect: https://github.com/xwiki-contrib/macro-hierarchy-dynamic/tree/macro-hierarchy-dynamic-1.0  
12:10 <vmassol> the pom.xml says 1.0-SNAPSHOT when it should say 1.0  
12:10 <vmassol> that's because you did a prepare with the wrong release plugin version  
12:11 <vmassol> hence the reason you need to rollback and redo the release prepare properly  
12:11 <vmassol> as documented in the link I pasted you'll need to manually remove the tag first  
12:11 <Lyes> ok  
12:16 <woshilapin> has quit  
12:20 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
12:21 <vmassol> hmm jenkins is becoming slow again :(  
12:42 <Lyes> @Vincent : done thanks  
12:42 <Enygma`> vmassol: have a look at the agents  
12:42 <Enygma`> this keeps happening  
12:42 <Enygma`> all agents appear offline  
12:43 <Enygma`> well, except 3-2, but still  
12:43 <vmassol> if the master doeesn't communicate with them they are taken offline I guess  
12:43 <vmassol> since hte master is using 800% cpu that's no wonder  
12:43 <vmassol> we need to find out hwy it's using 800%  
12:44 <Enygma`> the website is responsive though  
12:44 <vmassol> depends  
12:45 <vmassol> it's not for me when I click on some jobs  
12:45 <Enygma`> http://ci.xwiki.org/threadDump  
12:45 <Enygma`> Caused by: java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: GC overhead limit exceeded  
12:46 <vmassol> indeed  
12:46 <vmassol> we might just be missing memory  
13:07 <Denis> has quit  
13:53 <Denis1> has joined #xwiki  
13:54 <Denis1> is now known as <Denis>  
14:04 <Lyes> has quit  
14:04 <Lyes> has joined #xwiki  
14:15 <vmassol> Lyes: I don't see your extension on http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/WebHome  
14:29 <Denis> has quit  
14:49 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
15:03 <msmeria> has quit  
15:08 <andreeapopescu> has quit  
15:10 <momomomomo> has joined #xwiki  
15:11 <Lyes> i need to promote my release of Dynamic Hierarchy Macro Macro from the staging repository on Nexus, can someone help me  
15:12 <vmassol> Lyes: why did you delete the page on e.x.o that you had created?  
15:12 <vmassol> ah bad name  
15:12 <Lyes> yes , i juste rename it  
15:13 <vmassol> for nexus, why don't you try to perform it yourself?  
15:13 <vmassol> also when you write content ofr xwiki.org please don't use absolute links as you've done  
15:13 <vmassol> always use wiki links  
15:13 <Lyes> i don't have permissions  
15:13 <vmassol> are you sure because I gave them to you  
15:13 <vmassol> ?  
15:14 <vmassol> (I just added the deployer role about 5 minutes ago)  
15:14 <vmassol> also don't use tthings like this:  
15:14 <vmassol> jsTree ( http://www.jstree.com/ )  
15:14 <vmassol> [[jsTree>>http://…]] is the way to do it  
15:15 <vmassol> also you need to set the proper extension id on http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Dynamic+Hierarchy+Macro  
15:17 <vmassol> see http://contrib.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/WebHome#HDocumenting  
15:26 <Lyes> @Vincent : i have "Nexus returned an error: ERROR 403: Forbidden"  when i open Staging Repositories  
15:30 <vmassol> you've logged out and logged in again?  
15:30 <Lyes> yes  
15:31 <vmassol> could you try again?  
15:33 <Lyes> done , but the same thing  
15:36 <vmassol> hmmm  
15:36 <vmassol> ok let me promote it for you then  
15:36 <vmassol> is everything ok for the promotion?  
15:37 <vmassol> I see you were able to close the repo  
15:38 <vmassol> done  
15:38 <Lyes> yes  
15:38 <Lyes> thanks  
15:46 <vmassol> Lyes: why are you deleting objects?  
15:48 <Lyes> i put org.xwiki.contrib:macro-hierarchy-dynamic instead of org.xwiki.contrib:macro-hierarchy-dynamic-ui  
15:52 <vmassol> indeed  
16:06 <woshilapin> has quit  
16:12 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
16:31 <vmassol> @Lyes: would be nice to add a screenshot for your macro that makes the page nicer to look at :)  
16:31 <mflorea1> has joined #xwiki  
16:31 <vmassol> >>  
16:32 <Lyes> yes :)  
16:32 <vmassol> missing "the" too

16:32 <mflorea> has quit

17:45 <mflorea1> has quit  
17:47 <momomomomo> has quit  
17:59 <Enygma`> gdelhumeau: any idea about http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-webstandards/lastBuild/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-webstandards/testReport/org.xwiki.test.webstandards.framework/DefaultValidationTest/Validating\_XHTML\_validity\_for\_\_space\_ColorThemes\_\_page\_WizardWebColors\_executed\_with\_credentials\_Admin\_admin/ ?  
17:59 <Enygma`> all pages seem to fail validation now http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-webstandards/lastBuild/testReport/ (1700 failures)  
18:00 <Enygma`> might be because of the doctype change?  
18:03 <gdelhumeau> Enygma`: indeed  
18:03 <gdelhumeau> see http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-7552  
18:04 <Enygma`> gdelhumeau: so what do we do about it?  
18:05 <gdelhumeau> After a discussion with vmassol, we thought we should disable validation-test during the next few weeks  
18:05 <gdelhumeau> and enable them back as soon as we can  
18:05 <gdelhumeau> and accept the fact that 6.2 is not valid from the html PoV  
18:06 <gdelhumeau> vmassol: should I send a vote for that?  
18:06 <Enygma`> gdelhumeau: you seem to have committed to that issue on 08/Apr/14 but the issue is still opened  
18:06 <Enygma`> that means that several releases have passed and that issue is still opened with commits already performed on it  
18:07 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: no need for a vote IMO but jsut a mail to let other know about it and ask them to let you know quickly if that's an issue  
18:07 <gdelhumeau> yes we have a HTML5 validator now on platform  
18:07 <Enygma`> we should try as much as possible to avoid having this cases  
18:07 <vmassol> yes definitely  
18:08 <vmassol> it's bad  
18:08 <gdelhumeau> yes I should have created a new issue for that  
18:08 <Enygma`> so the issue needs to be closed and a new issue needs to be created with the remaining work  
18:08 <Enygma`> and a proper fix version needs to be set corresponding with the date of the commit  
18:08 <Enygma`> it`s only 1 commit so it`s easy to fix  
18:08 <gdelhumeau> but it's just a very very beginning  
18:08 <vmassol> (I was referring to the disabling of the validation tests)  
18:08 <Enygma`> so we agree that the validation tests are going to fail  
18:09 <gdelhumeau> I mean this commit is only a smal step to that issue  
18:09 <vmassol> well  
18:09 <vmassol> I also asked gdelhumeau to check the validation tests  
18:09 <vmassol> because I don't think it's all or nothing  
18:10 <vmassol> maybe some tests will continue to pass on html5 and only some need to be temporarily disabled?  
18:10 <gdelhumeau> no  
18:10 <gdelhumeau> because the headers are the same for every page  
18:10 <vmassol> for ex I don't see hwy all WCAG tesst woudl fail  
18:10 <gdelhumeau> and there is pb on headers  
18:10 <vmassol> and?  
18:10 <vmassol> that's only 1 test  
18:11 <gdelhumeau> hmm maybe about WCAG it's not an issue indeed  
18:11 <vmassol> there are a lot more  
18:12 <vmassol> would be nice if you could fix the listtool issue too Enygma`  
18:12 <vmassol> normally it would fail the validation tests  
18:12 <vmassol> because in there we check for empty console logs :)  
18:12 <vmassol> (which is checked voluntarily)  
18:13 <Enygma`> hmm, as far as I understand it, I need to replace all usage of the list tool with regular checks on velocity lists  
18:13 <Enygma`> will look into it, but 1st step would be to deprecate the velocity tool on the docs  
18:13 <vmassol> that would still fail our build rule  
18:13 <vmassol> that no warning goes in the logs for a release  
18:14 <vmassol> (for the code that we provide)  
18:14 <vmassol> (not for outside extensions of course)  
18:15 <vmassol> actually we're not fully checking this one, only through templates I think but not in wiki pages, would be nice to check  
18:16 <Enygma`> even for milestones?  
18:16 <vmassol> ideally only for final  
18:16 <vmassol> well  
18:16 <vmassol> we need to report if before final  
18:16 <vmassol> otherwise they won't get fixed  
18:17 <vmassol> so it's porbably best to fail even for milestones  
18:18 <Enygma`> damn... 13 wysiwyg tests failing... http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-wysiwyg/lastBuild/testReport/  
18:25 <gdelhumeau> ps ax | grep jetty returns 2 lines in agent3-3  
18:25 <Lyes> has quit  
18:26 <vmassol> yes  
18:26 <vmassol> not normal to have only 1 since there's no job running on it  
18:26 <vmassol> let's see what last ran there  
18:27 <vmassol> IMO it's a cluster test that failed  
18:27 <vmassol> indeed: http://ci.xwiki.org/computer/agent-3-3/builds  
18:27 <vmassol> hmm no  
18:27 <vmassol> ah yes  
18:27 <vmassol> on this agent  
18:27 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
18:27 <vmassol> 12:16:50.585 [Thread-2] ERROR o.x.t.i.XWikiLogOutputStream - Error binding monitor port 8079: java.net.BindException: Cannot assign requested address  
18:28 <vmassol> (at http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-cluster/3487/console)  
18:28 <vmassol> 12:17:01.639 [Thread-2] ERROR o.x.t.i.XWikiLogOutputStream - Caused by: java.net.BindException: No available port to bind to in range [7800 .. 7850]  
18:28 <vmassol> strange range  
18:28 <vmassol> ah jgroups  
18:28 <vmassol> 12:17:01.639 [Thread-2] ERROR o.x.t.i.XWikiLogOutputStream - at org.jgroups.util.Util.createServerSocket(Util.java:3561) ~[jgroups-3.4.4.Final.jar:3.4.4.Final]  
18:30 <vmassol> hmm looking at the end of http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-cluster/3487/console it seems the job was forcefully stopped  
18:31 <vmassol> stop failed for one instance and the other instance didn't even get a chance to try stopping  
18:33 <vmassol> so this caused build 175 to have problems starting xwiki  
18:33 <vmassol> http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-jmeter/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-jmeter/175/console  
18:33 <vmassol> 8:05:09.994 [Thread-2] ERROR o.x.t.i.XWikiLogOutputStream - java.net.BindException: Address already in use  
18:34 <vmassol> would be interesting to know why there was no free port in the range 7800-7850 that's 50 port values  
18:37 <gdelhumeau> can I kill them?  
18:37 <vmassol> yes  
18:44 <gdelhumeau> java.lang.RuntimeException: Failed to initialize PersistentTestContext  
18:44 <gdelhumeau> at org.xwiki.test.ui.PageObjectSuite.beforeTests(PageObjectSuite.java:67)  
18:44 <gdelhumeau> what does it means?  
18:45 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: you need the nested exception  
18:45 <gdelhumeau> Caused by: org.openqa.selenium.WebDriverException: Unable to bind to locking port 7054 within 45000 ms  
18:45 <gdelhumeau> Build info: version: '2.40.0', revision: '4c5c0568b004f67810ee41c459549aa4b09c651e', time: '2014-02-19 11:13:01'  
18:48 <KermitTheFragger> has quit  
18:49 <Enygma`> I`ve sent a mail during the weekend about that  
18:49 <Enygma`> happens on the 6.1 branch as well  
18:50 <Enygma`> hmm, any idea why I can`t run a wysiwyg test straight from my IDE (Eclipse)?  
18:50 <vmassol> I think that means the webdriver client side (ie from the test code) is failing to connect to the webdriver plugin installed in FF  
18:50 <vmassol> not sure why though  
18:50 <Enygma`> I get a NPE in AbstractXWikiTestCase.open(String url) { getSelenium().open(url); }  
18:51 <Enygma`> XWikiSeleniumTestSetup.setUp() does not seem to be called to initialize stuff  
18:51 <vmassol> no idea, I know that I have had pb on mac but it's a different error than yours  
18:52 <Enygma`> will be hard to debug with just the mvn command line  
18:52 <vmassol> it's supposed to work from the IDE  
18:54 <gdelhumeau> From my side, I have different behaviours with maven and with my IDE  
18:54 <gdelhumeau> and the build is different too  
18:56 <vmassol> where?  
18:56 <vmassol> I've never seen any difference  
18:56 <vmassol> except for timing issues but that's normal  
18:57 <vmassol> (try @intermittent annotations for debugging flickers)  
18:57 <gdelhumeau> from my maven I have failed tests that does not fail when I run them manually on my IDE  
18:57 <vmassol> that means these tests are badly written  
18:57 <vmassol> they work in your IDE because it's slower  
18:57 <gdelhumeau> maybe because I have fixed them and maven did not recompile the needed classes  
18:57 <vmassol> they're missing waits  
18:58 <gdelhumeau> but I have manually done mvn clean install on the dependencies  
18:58 <gdelhumeau> hmm indeed  
19:05 <gdelhumeau> see you  
19:05 <gdelhumeau> has quit  
19:13 <momomomomo> has joined #xwiki  
19:18 <momomomomo> has quit  
19:19 <Enygma`> kind of managed to get it running from the IDE (had to execute AllTests, use -Dpattern to specify the test class, and had to set some working and base dir properties from surefire's configuration in pom.xml since m2e was not helping me here)  
19:20 <vmassol> for webdrvier tests you just need to start XE first from teh command line  
19:20 <vmassol> I even added a message about that 3 days ago  
19:20 <vmassol> (in XWikiExecutor)  
19:21 <vmassol> "  
19:21 <vmassol> from http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/Testing#HGUItests  
19:24 <Enygma`> did not work for the wysiwyg tests at least  
19:24 <Enygma`> since in AllTests is manually instantiates XWikiSeleniumTestSetup  
19:24 <vmassol> that's sel1  
19:25 <Enygma`> and Eclipse's jUnit plugin does not seem to look in AllTests  
19:25 <Enygma`> yes, probably that`s why  
19:25 <Enygma`> selenium 1  
19:25 <vmassol> so for sel1  
19:25 <Enygma`> so I have to tell the IDE to look in AllTests  
19:25 <vmassol> you need to read http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/Testing#HOldSelenium1-basedFramework  
19:25 <vmassol> anyway I don't remember that well sel1 tests  
19:26 <vmassol> too old :)  
19:26 <Enygma`> hmm, that might work :)  
19:27 <Enygma`> though what I have now seems to be working as well :)
